TopicTitle: Spacecraft start to wobble at high speeds, their textures deteriorate and it applies even after i've come to a stop?

Articles.Content: See title. Also happened to me with a kerbal in a Mun landing. Only mods I have are some plane mods, but none modify any values as far as I know.
Wobbly spacecraft can be solved by MOAR STRUTS. Can you post a screenshot of the plane? Thanks a lot.

10 hours ago, scootr1542 said:

Spacecraft start to wobble at high speeds, their textures deteriorate and it applies even after i've come to a stop?

 

Hi, I think we can say with some certainty that if in fact your craft is  wobbling, it is not related to the texture problem.   However the texture problem can indeed make a ship look like it's wobbling as bits flicker and disappear momentarily,  it looks wobbly but isn't.   Many of us are experiencing the texture problem, just check out recent KSP youtube vids, you'll see lots of the same behavior . some interesting comments on the problem below .

SO you can see that there's not a lot you can do about it, aside from go back to KSP 1.3.1 or wait until Unity fix the game engine,  It's not really even a thing that Squad can do anything about , as I'm guessing they've already optimised their texture bundles to the maximum

38 minutes ago, SpannerMonkey(smce) said:

6

I'm certain the wobble isn't a sort of visual illusion caused by the textures, as the mun landing previously mentioned ended in disaster after the ship started spazzing out even though it had landed safely, but thanks for the answer.

After some testing, I've found out it doesn't affect small ships, but rather big ones (lots of parts), and no, it's not related to struts. While trying to see if I could pull off Apollo 13, the wobble appeared again, minor when inside the atmosphere but it got really bad when I entered space, will post screenshots later.
